laboratory_examinations.findings: Deep-vein thrombosis of the left common femoral vein extending into the tibial trunk.
Multiple pulmonary emboli in the pulmonary arteries in the left lower lobe and right lower lobe with a small wedge-shaped infarction at the left lung base.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Partial-thromboplastin times had been consistently in the therapeutic range during heparin therapy.

findings.MTHFR: Heterozygosity for the thermolabile C677T polymorphism, normal homocysteine level.
findings.lupus_anticoagulant_test: Prolonged dilute Russell’s viper–venom time with positive hexagonal-phase phospholipid neutralization test

laboratory_examinations.findings: Occlusive thrombus from the left common femoral vein to the tibial trunk and popliteal vein, with extension of the clot proximally.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Compared with the ultrasonogram obtained on admission, showed progression.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Nonocclusive deep-vein thrombosis involving the left femoral, popliteal, and calf veins.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased respiratory variability in the Doppler waveforms of the left common and external iliac veins.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Post-thrombolysis platelet count dropped to 153,000 per cubic millimeter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Returned to the normal range after changing anticoagulation from heparin to argatroban.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive, with an optical density of 1.025 (normal, <0.40).
Deep-vein thrombosis in the left common, external, and internal iliac veins extending into the common femoral vein.
Remained in the range of 210,000 to 250,000 per cubic millimeter.
